solution_line_template: In the first semester, she scored {second_semester_math_marks}+{math_mark_difference} = <<{second_semester_math_marks}+{math_mark_difference}={first_semester_math_marks}>>{first_semester_math_marks} marks in maths

She also scores {second_semester_arts_marks}-{arts_mark_difference} = <<{second_semester_arts_marks}-{arts_mark_difference}={first_semester_arts_marks}>>{first_semester_arts_marks} marks in arts in the first semester.

She scored {science_fraction_less} marks less in science in the first semester than the second, which is {science_fraction_less}*{second_semester_science_marks} = <<{science_fraction_less}*{second_semester_science_marks}={science_mark_reduction}>>{science_mark_reduction}

Her score in science in the first semester is {second_semester_science_marks}-{science_mark_reduction} = <<{second_semester_science_marks}-{science_mark_reduction}={first_semester_science_marks}>>{first_semester_science_marks}

The total for the first semester is {first_semester_math_marks}+{first_semester_arts_marks}+{first_semester_science_marks} = <<{first_semester_math_marks}+{first_semester_arts_marks}+{first_semester_science_marks}={total_first_semester_marks}>>{total_first_semester_marks}

The total for the second semester is {second_semester_arts_marks}+{second_semester_science_marks}+{second_semester_math_marks} = <<{second_semester_arts_marks}+{second_semester_science_marks}+{second_semester_math_marks}={total_second_semester_marks}>>{total_second_semester_marks}

The combined marks for all the semesters in {total_second_semester_marks}+{total_first_semester_marks} = <<{total_second_semester_marks}+{total_first_semester_marks}={combined_total_marks}>>{combined_total_marks}
